--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Elliotte Harold <elharo@m...> wrote:
> Shane Mingins wrote:
> 
> >  If using TDD you are slowly emerging the design. Why would
Extract Class 
> > not be a valid refactoring? At some point a private method on a
class wants 
> > to be a class in it's own. Am I missing something?
> 
> If extracting a class causes a method to become public that otherwise 
> wouldn't be public, then it's a problem. 

I always default my "Extract Class" to package-private classes, the
same as my default "Extract Method" is to a private method.

If I decide I want functionality from the extracted class accessible
from another package, it's usually a sign that I've got a new
abstraction that's probably worth making public. At that point, I'll
extract the functionality out appropriately.
